mapper.select:
select count(*) from (select count(*) from
company_mem c
join company_info ci on c.c_no = ci.c_no left join company_welfare cw on ci.c_no=cw.c_no left join code_welfare wc on cw.welfare_code=wc.welfare_code left join review r on c.c_no = r.c_no
where 1=1
and ( upper(addr) like upper('%${sido}%') )
and ( upper(addr) like upper('%${gugun}%') )
and business_industry = #{selectedIndustry}
and ( upper(name) like upper('%${keyword}%') )
GROUP BY ci.c_no,name,business_industry,sales,sal_avg,addr
having
LISTAGG(wc.welfare_name, ',') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY wc.welfare_name) like '%${tmp}%'
)
select count(*) from company_info
select f.b_no , p.name , p.phone , f.preferred_work , f.start_time , f.end_time , to_char(f.reg_date,'YYYY-MM-DD') as "reg_date" from freelancer f, person_mem p where f.p_no = p.p_no
select f.b_no , p.name , p.phone , f.hope_work , f.start_time , f.end_time , to_char(f.reg_date,'YYYY-MM-DD') as "reg_date" from part_time f, person_mem p where f.p_no = p.p_no
select subject, c.field_name, reg_date from project b, competition_project_field_code c, person_mem p where p.p_no = b.p_no and b.field_code = c.code_field
select subject,read_count, reg_date from competition b, company_mem c where b.c_no = c.c_no
select c_no from gonggo

select p.p_no, b.b_no, p.nickname, b.subject, b.content, b.read_count, to_char(b.reg_date,'YYYY-MM-DD') as "reg_date",
b.rec_count
b.price, b.trade_type
from ${tablename} b, person_mem p where b.p_no = p.p_no and b.b_no=#{b_no}

select b_no ,p.p_no ,p.name ,p.phone ,p.addr ,c.career ,t.pwd ,t.hope_work ,t.start_time ,t.end_time ,t.content ,to_char(t.reg_date, 'YYYY-MM-DD') as "reg_date"
from person_mem p , part_time t , career c where t.b_no=#{t.b_no} and t.p_no=p.p_no and t.p_no=c.p_no

select f.b_no ,p.p_no ,p.name ,p.phone ,p.addr ,c.career ,f.pwd ,f.preferred_work ,f.start_time ,f.end_time ,f.content ,to_char(f.reg_date, 'YYYY-MM-DD HH24:MI') as "reg_date" from person_mem p, freelancer f, career c where f.b_no=#{f.b_no} and f.p_no=p.p_no and f.p_no=c.p_no
select m.c_no, m.name, i.url, m.email, i.volume, i.sales, i.emp_no, i.birth, m.ceo_name, m.call, i.sal_avg from company_mem m ,company_info i where #{c_no}=m.c_no and m.c_no=i.c_no

select m.c_no, LISTAGG(cw.welfare_name,',') WITHIN GROUP (ORDER BY cw.welfare_code) AS welfare from company_mem m , code_welfare cw, company_welfare c where #{c_no}=m.c_no and m.c_no=c.c_no and cw.welfare_code=c.welfare_code
group by m.c_no
select p_no, c_no, content, star, rec_count from review where c_no=#{c_no}

select r_no, p_no, content, star from review where c_no = ${c_no}
order by ${reviewSort}
select count(*) from review where c_no= ${c_no}
select count(*) from review
select m.c_no, m.name, i.url, m.email, i.volume, i.sales, i.emp_no, i.birth, m.ceo_name, m.call, i.sal_avg from company_mem m ,company_info i where #{c_no}=m.c_no and m.c_no=i.c_no
select count(*) from ${boardname}
select c_no from like_company where p_no = #{p_no}

select category, n_no, subject, content, to_char(reg_date, 'YYYY-MM-DD') as reg_date,
read_count from notice where 1=1
order by reg_date desc

select count(*) from notice where 1=1
and ( upper(subject) like upper('%${keyword}%') or upper(content) like upper('%${keyword}%') )
select count(*) from notice
select n_no, subject, content, read_count, to_char(reg_date, 'YYYY-MM-DD') as reg_date, category from notice where n_no=#{n_no}
mapper.update: update notice set read_count = read_count + 1 where n_no=#{n_no}
